body.p: This chapter describes the installation of the most vital components used in 's Web-based Shared Translation Memory concept. It is assumed, that is already installed on the client PC and possibly on the server too.
body.note: Installing on the server would only be required to make the OtmTMService available on the server. However, this service is part of the client installation, and it would be sufficient to only copy the entire OtmTMService directory from the client PC to the server PC.
body.p:
currently supports two different databases:
MariaDB
MySQL
In this documentation, we describe the usage of MariaDB, but the installation and usage of MySQL is similar.
From the MariaDB-website at https://downloads.mariadb.org/, download the package mariadb-10.1.17-winx64.msi (or higher) to the local hard disk drive on the server.
body.note: MariaDB is not part of the installer package, but a 3rd party open source module used by .
